body_html: @millisecond Maybe try feed data into a TF buffered queue, and the training OPs will read the data from that queue. It still cost more CPU cycles for RPC (protobuf is not suitable for TF's need, yet still being used), but hopefully it will not have visible impact to the training time.
body_text: @millisecond Maybe try feed data into a TF buffered queue, and the training OPs will read the data from that queue. It still cost more CPU cycles for RPC (protobuf is not suitable for TF's need, yet still being used), but hopefully it will not have visible impact to the training time.
body: @millisecond Maybe try feed data into a TF buffered queue, and the training OPs will read the data from that queue. It still cost more CPU cycles for RPC (protobuf is **not** suitable for TF's need, yet still being used), but hopefully it will not have visible impact to the training time.
